docs.snippet: More industries are following Hollywood’s lottery system, offering potential wealth in exchange for terrible hours and low pay....
docs.lead_paragraph: More industries are following Hollywood’s lottery system, offering potential wealth in exchange for terrible hours and low pay.
docs.abstract: Adam Davidson It's the Economy column notes the Hollywood film industry is a model lottery system in which lower level workers earn low wages with the expectation that they may become spectacularly successful; says similar systems used by other industries worked in the past because those who drop out of their dream industry were able to find jobs with decent wages in other industries, but that is no longer the case.

headline.main: Why Are Harvard Graduates in the Mailroom?
headline.print_headline: Hey, Actos: Accountants Have Dreams, too!

docs.snippet: 8 P.M. (HBO2) RAISING RENEE (2011) Beverly McIver long ago promised her mother that she would take care of her mentally disabled sister, Renee. In 2004, just as Beverly's career as a painter was taking off, her mother died, requiring her to make g...
docs.lead_paragraph: 8 P.M. (HBO2) RAISING RENEE (2011) Beverly McIver long ago promised her mother that she would take care of her mentally disabled sister, Renee. In 2004, just as Beverly's career as a painter was taking off, her mother died, requiring her to make good on her pledge to Renee, then a 44-year-old who functioned at the level of a third grader. This documentary from Steven Ascher and Jeanne Jordan follows Beverly as she moves Renee, above, from her lifelong home in Greensboro, N.C., to Arizona, where Beverly lived and worked, and then back again to be closer to family. Renee eventually settles into an assisted-living apartment complex to live independently, something unthinkable when her mother was alive. 7:30 A.M. (Oxygen) A WALK ON THE MOON (1999) Diane Lane plays Pearl Kantrowitz, who totes her ironing board, children and mother-in-law to a camp in the Catskills each summer, while her husband, Marty (Liev Schreiber), stays in New York City, repairing television sets. Viggo Mortensen plays the hippie salesman who turns her life upside down in 1969, as the moon walk and Woodstock loom. Writing in The New York Times about this romance from Tony Goldwyn, Janet Maslin said, ''Even when it turns turbulent, the film sustains its warm summer glow and makes itself a conversation piece about the moral issues it means to raise.''

docs.snippet: Officials in the state of Nuevo León said the jailbreak and the massacre had been carried out by the Zetas, a gang of drug enforcers who appeared to have prison authorities under control....
docs.lead_paragraph: Officials in the state of Nuevo León said the jailbreak and the massacre had been carried out by the Zetas, a gang of drug enforcers who appeared to have prison authorities under control.
docs.abstract: Investigators question guards in ongoing inquiry into gang fight at Apodaca prison outside Monterrey, Mexico; it appears that as many as 16 guards and officials have been implicated in melee in which guards released members of the Zeta gang and then opened cells of members of rival Gulf Cartel, resulting in fight in which 44 prisoners were bludgeoned, beaten or stabbed to death.

headline.seo: Guards Implicated in Mexican Gang Violence in Prison
headline.main: Guards Implicated in Mexico Prison’s Deadly Gang Attack
headline.print_headline: Guards Aided Mexico Gang In Jail Attack
